Articles.Content:
I've just been watching a YouTube tutorial by Orb8Ter on launching rockets. He's able to click on data panels containing sliders for thrust adjustment, etc. What I want to know is how he pulls them around the screen. I've tried this sort of thing but nothing moves on the screen. What's the key combination? I hope this is clear to someone.

Edited October 7, 2015 by JackBush
A picture or a link to a video with a time would be really helpful here.

You are talking about the Thrust Limiter I presume? The tweakable menu? I am unaware of a mod to pull them around the screen. There is a mod to keep them from shaking around on reentry. You should link a video and timestamp to show us what you mean.
You're right. Here's a link to the video I was watching: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/133444-Video-Launch-Tutorial-As-the-first-part-is-the-hardest-part

You're right. Here's a link to the video I was watching: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/133444-Video-Launch-Tutorial-As-the-first-part-is-the-hardest-part

Where is he dragging them around the screen? Unless you are talking about Kerbal Engineer?
That seems to be the mod Kerbal Engineer Redux that you are talking about. You can get it here: KER Forum Page
